alert.note: Alert for Cocke Smoky Mountains; Northwest Cocke (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 07 at 6:54PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN COCKE COUNTY THROUGH 845 PM EDT... At 754 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Smoky Mountains-Big Creek, or 10 miles southeast of Newport. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Del Rio and Hartford. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
